xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" />           </LegendURL>         </Style>       </Layer>       <Layer queryable="1">         <Name>1</Name>         <Title><![CDATA[Jacksonville Bathymetry]]></Title>         <Abstract><![CDATA[These data represent bathymetry collected by NOAA\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds Office of Coast Survey. The hydrographic surveys were conducted in 1974, 1998, and 1999. The bathymetry is intended to show where water depths support deep draft vessels anchoring near the St. John\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds River entrance channel.]]></Abstract> <CRS>CRS:84</CRS> <CRS>EPSG:4326</CRS> <CRS>EPSG:3857</CRS>  <!-- alias 3857 --> <CRS>EPSG:102100</CRS> <EX_GeographicBoundingBox><westBoundLongitude>-81.395613</westBoundLongitude><eastBoundLongitude>-81.147152</eastBoundLongitude><southBoundLatitude>30.334631</southBoundLatitude><northBoundLatitude>30.580703</northBoundLatitude></EX_GeographicBoundingBox> <BoundingBox CRS="CRS:84" minx="-81.395613" miny="30.334631" maxx="-81.147152" maxy="30.580703"/> <BoundingBox CRS="EPSG:4326" minx="30.334631" miny="-81.395613" maxx="30.580703" maxy="-81.147152"/> <BoundingBox CRS="EPSG:3857" minx="-9060918.180890" miny="3546636.433301" maxx="-9033259.665696" maxy="3578414.301821"/>         <Style>           <Name>default</Name>           <Title>1</Title>           <LegendURL width="100" height="48">             <Format>image/png</Format>             <OnlineResource xlink:href="http://coast.noaa.gov/arcgis/services/MarineCadastre/AISStoryMap/MapServer/WmsServer?request=GetLegendGraphic%26version=1.3.0%26format=image/png%26layer=1" xlink:type="simple" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" />           </LegendURL>         </Style>       </Layer>       <Layer queryable="1">         <Name>2</Name>         <Title><![CDATA[AIS Anchoring Locations]]></Title>         <Abstract><![CDATA[These data represent select 2011 Automatic Identification System (AIS) data available from MarineCadastre.gov. All vessel records reporting speed over ground less than or equal to 1 knot were queried and extracted from the annual data set. This subset of data is intended to represent anchoring locations of unique vessels anchoring near the channel entrance of St. John\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds River in Jacksonville, Florida.]]></Abstract> <CRS>CRS:84</CRS> <CRS>EPSG:4326</CRS> <CRS>EPSG:3857</CRS>  <!-- alias 3857 --> <CRS>EPSG:102100</CRS> <EX_GeographicBoundingBox><westBoundLongitude>-81.375825</westBoundLongitude><eastBoundLongitude>-81.174764</eastBoundLongitude><southBoundLatitude>30.313494</southBoundLatitude><northBoundLatitude>30.566041</northBoundLatitude></EX_GeographicBoundingBox> <BoundingBox CRS="CRS:84" minx="-81.375825" miny="30.313494" maxx="-81.174764" maxy="30.566041"/> <BoundingBox CRS="EPSG:4326" minx="30.313494" miny="-81.375825" maxx="30.566041" maxy="-81.174764"/> <BoundingBox CRS="EPSG:3857" minx="-9058715.395100" miny="3543910.591000" maxx="-9036333.393400" maxy="3576518.648200"/>         <Style>           <Name>default</Name>           <Title>2</Title>           <LegendURL width="124" height="4096">             <Format>image/png</Format>             <OnlineResource xlink:href="http://coast.noaa.gov/arcgis/services/MarineCadastre/AISStoryMap/MapServer/WmsServer?request=GetLegendGraphic%26version=1.3.0%26format=image/png%26layer=2" xlink:type="simple" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" />           </LegendURL>         </Style>       </Layer>       <Layer queryable="1">         <Name>3</Name>         <Title><![CDATA[Danger Area]]></Title>         <Abstract><![CDATA[This charted danger area identifies a zone where mines were placed during World War II. Captains are often concerned about anchoring within danger areas, even when local harbor pilots say it is safe to do so.]]></Abstract> <CRS>CRS:84</CRS> <CRS>EPSG:4326</CRS> <CRS>EPSG:3857</CRS>  <!-- alias 3857 --> <CRS>EPSG:102100</CRS> Anchorage]]></Title>         <Abstract><![CDATA[This anchorage was initially proposed because it covers much of the area ships are currently anchoring in, but the proposed area is out of range of major transit paths.]]></Abstract> <CRS>CRS:84</CRS> <CRS>EPSG:4326</CRS> <CRS>EPSG:3857</CRS>  <!-- alias 3857 --> <CRS>EPSG:102100</CRS>
